nodes.bodyText: I don't think "-log" works any more
Probably not, I'll remove it. I was just copying from existing tests.

Not sure about this magic number.
Are we directly using this library file? Maybe document any modifications?

Yes as you say, this is all code that I took from cache2k and I don't know what their reasoning was for choosing it. I may just remove this because I'm not seeing a substantial difference between the memory measurement and the "settled" memory numbers.
Why increase the time to 60 seconds?

Since this test uses mvn exec it needs to compile and then run the code. I found that this test has been occasionally failing in GitHub CI, so increasing this timeout just gives it more time to build on a slow machine. But I can definitely put it back to 30 if you want.

This is netty-all, which includes all of netty including things that we don't need. We already have separate dependencies for the components of netty that we actually use.
I found that this was included because the shade plugin identified duplicate class names were being included in the uber jar.
So this is measuring one data point?

That's correct. If we want more data points once we have more complicated tests, then we would call this multiple times and all the data points would be averaged under the current implementation. Though we may want to change the handling to either treat them as separate data points or to aggregate them in a different way.
Why 60 seconds instead of default value?
I will change this. I was seeing that the kernel wasn't properly shutting down, so I tried giving it more time. Ultimately it was resolved with my change to Copier which makes them daemon threads.
Is this the file containing the profile data?
Yes, by default the file name is that, though it can be changed if we wanted to.
